snippet: As society embraces all forms of digital entertainment, a latter-day Noah is looking the other way. Brewster Kahle, who runs the Internet Archive, a nonprofit, hopes to collect one copy of every book.
abstract: Brewster Khale, head of the nonprofit Internet Archive, is attempting to acquire a copy of every book ever printed; began his collection while digitizing books for the Archive, whose main purpose is to retain a digital copy of all Web pages; sees a complete print archive as a necessary safeguard against the ever-changing world of digital technology.
lead_paragraph: As society embraces all forms of digital entertainment, a latter-day Noah is looking the other way. Brewster Kahle, who runs the Internet Archive, a nonprofit, hopes to collect one copy of every book.

headline.seo: Internet Archive’s Repository Collects Thousands of Books
headline.main: In a Flood Tide of Digital Data, an Ark Full of Books
headline.print_headline: In a Flood Tide of Digital Data, An Ark Full of Books and Film
